value: hi we're back we're talking about
improving your skill so pronunciation
practice is a very physical practice
just like lifting weights you're not
going to be able to lift a hundred
pounds more than you can right away you
have to work your way up and it's the
same thing with accent training there
are some certain things that can click
and some significant reductions that can
take place immediately
but for the most part you're building
and allowing your muscles in your mouth
to become more skillful these are micro
muscles and small muscles and you've
been saying incorrect things incorrect
sounds incorrect pronunciation for
probably years so it's a it's a it's a
habit
it's an ingrained pattern and it's a
muscular pattern that we have to break
so the way of breaking this pattern is
first of all do some exercises to to be
more aware of your physiology most
people are speaking they have no idea
where their tongue is and that's natural
but now we're going to start becoming
way more aware of our physiology so just
like a singer or an actor we are going
to do some warm-up exercises to break
the old muscular patterns so we can
start to ingrain some new patterns so go
ahead and feel free to be goofy you're
by yourself now just explore your face
open your mouth as wide as you can make
different sounds from high to low and do
some yawning to stretch the vocal cords
and you can make sure you're keeping
your vocal cords nice and and moist with
some water okay so stretching your mouth
sticking your tongue out making all
kinds of weird ugly faces you can do in
front of the mirror to really see
yourself and and how you speak and the
way you use your body and you can take
your voice from high to low and low to
high it's really important for learning
different accents so high high high high
high high high high
low low low low low up back to high some
languages like in Southeast Asia their
register is all up in the nasal cavity
and upper throat and they very rarely go
down low now the American accents a very
low accent so you have to learn to relax
your throat muscles you can hold your
throat to gain more awareness relax your
throat and explore a different register
of your voice than you normally use okay
that's it for a warm-up practice let's
get started with the next segment
